intro: Borbonia vestita, commonly known as the white-flowered borbonia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs.
